Experience Program Manager, Corporate Engineering Google July 2015  – Present (1 month) Greater New York City Area People Development Program Manager Google August 2013  –  July 2015  (2 years) Greater New York City Area - Drive adoption of career development platform, Grow. Build partner relationships and provide client-facing teams with resources to market Grow’s benefits to Googlers.  
- Grow highlighted in Fortune Magazine’s 2014 #1 Place to Work feature 
- Serve on launch team for Real-Time Feedback tool, including product development, early adopter training and global outreach efforts. 
- Manage Analytics for Grow, provide analysis to partners and stakeholders and produce quarterly reports on career development activity throughout the platform, learning needs analysis and feedback culture.  
- Partner with People Analytics to develop survey questions for inclusion in internal surveys and other tools to inform career development offerings and Grow product enhancement. 
- Gather regular input from cross-functional partners on product feature development. Translate needs of the business to our engineering partners. 
- Co-create and execute global communications campaign for Real-Time Feedback tool and quantify outreach success. Design and execute internal job search tool deprecation comms and outreach plan. 
 
Additional work- Team Development Facilitator: Consult with intact teams to design and facilitate custom development activities to accelerate their productivity or get them "unstuck." Google Alumni Program Manager Google August 2009  –  August 2013  (4 years 1 month) - Researched, designed and launched Google Alumni Network for 13,000+ former employees worldwide. www.googlealumni.com launched 10/05/10. First full-experience network offered to our former employees, complete with Google Apps, a searchable directory, multiple discussion groups, events, news, dedicated career center and perks. 
- Conceptualize and realize Google Alumni Impact Awards, a program to recognize Alumni making a difference in Not-for-profit space, now in 3rd year. www.googlealumni.com/impact 
- Lead team in out-of-box thinking, including initiatives such as entrepreneurial mixers with Google Ventures, AlumniServe portal for community service, and 2012 Hack4Good event to develop apps for NFP orgs. 
- Contribute best practices among 12 Alumni Colleagues across industries, sharing our innovations even as a relative newcomer to the Alumni space. 
- Launched TalentVine job interface for rehires, referrals and opportunities with Google Ventures’ portfolio and alumni companies. 
- Manage external software vendor in development of Network platform (SaaS) and community management. Strategize on product iterations and innovations specific to Google. 
- Manage relationships with various internal stakeholders: Legal, Recruiting, Google Ventures, Google.org, Benefits, Enterprise, CorpEng, Public Relations, Developer Relations, HR Business Partnerss, People Technology Operations and more. 
- Manage a team of two contributors. Student Engagement and Development Manager Google February 2012  –  October 2012  (9 months) Greater New York City Area - Led former TSD team through restructuring and broadening of scope.  
- Initiated transition of workflow from spreadsheets to Leadsforce for 10,000 leads- a team-wide process of 2500+ hours. 
- Redefined vision for team to include development of both the candidate and the computer scientist by blending upskilling programs and employment branding outreach. 
- Scaled outreach from 1:1 to a few to a new approach, including high-touch outreach for priority leads and scaled communications to all N. America student leads. 
- Held in-depth 1:1 career development discussions with team to calibrate with broader org and propel development, conversion, progression and mobility. 
- Doubled team resources and served as hiring manager for 7 roles. University Programs Specialist Google May 2006  –  July 2009  (3 years 3 months) - Managed relationships with major CS targets: Waterloo, CMU each had #1 recruiting ranking during my tenure. 
- Led 100+ individual and group meetings with faculty and deans to set strategy for Google’s campus efforts, promote Research Awards, seek Faculty Referrals & sponsorship opportunities. 
- Handled high profile Googler visits to campus, including Vint Cerf, Kai-Fu Lee, Josh Bloch, plus various Engineering Directors. Developed and shared Best Practice handbook for working with VIPs. 
- Strategized the best outreach approach for each client at target campuses. Served as Client Specialist for UER, UX and SRE to all targets. 
- Conceptualized and developed Computer Science Summer Institute for retention-focused, diverse rising sophomores in CS. Hosted summer program for ~20, creating living-learning environment, and agenda that includes custom CS course, social activities, affinity networking and career development. Associate Director, Employer and Alumni Relations Columbia University June 2004  –  April 2006  (1 year 11 months) - Promoted to Interim Director in time of vacancy, responsibilities including people management, policy development and enforcement, and all employer relationships (Vacancy 7/05 - 9/06). 
- Managed relationships with current and prospective employers.  
- Developed optimal recruitment strategies for employers, understanding their hiring needs and the avenues to the best candidates. Includes particular focus on diversity hiring and strategy in Finance, Consulting and STEM careers. 
- Managed several annual, consortium-based career fairs including employer recruitment, venue management and marketing for as many as 1400 attendees, 32 universities and 90 employers. Includes fairs focused on Engineering and Non-Profit careers.  
- Served on MonsterTRAK National Advisory Board with employer and school partners. Summary I joined Google's University Programs team in early 2011 at our headquarters in Mountain View, California. I transferred to our London office in July 2014 where I continue to focus on recruiting the best and brightest technical students to join us for internships and full-time roles. 
 
Outside of work, I'm an avid CrossFitter and love to travel. I'm extremely passionate about my sorority and just recently founded our organization's first alumnae chapter outside of North America. Brunch is my favorite meal of the day and I'm a stickler for polished communication and good grammar. 
 
More about me: 
 
I graduated from University of the Pacific in May 2010 where I earned a BS in Business Administration with a concentration in Marketing. During my years at Pacific I... 
- played on our Division 1 women's water polo team. 
- worked on campus as an event manager. 
- held executive positions in a variety of campus organizations. 
- was selected to join multiple honor societies. 
- led Pacific's chapter of the American Marketing Association as Vice President. 
 
Upon graduation I was selected by faculty and staff to receive the Eberhardt School of Business Outstanding Student Award in Marketing. I was also chosen as the Greek Woman of the Year based on my accomplishments within my sorority and the Greek community. 
 
I spent three months after graduation living with a family in northern Spain. After moving back to the Bay Area, I worked in campus marketing at Kno, Inc. then transitioned to my current role at Google on our University Programs team.
